attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: Withdraw all UK Government funding from PSNI.
attributes.background: Since the 'Good Friday' agreement there has been a total lack of commitment to investigate even-handedly the incidents which occurred during the conflict.  Some terrorists have actually received 'get out of jail' cards - yet the HIT are now concentrating on ex-members of HM Forces.

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: Support a Unilateral Declaration of Independence for the Kurdistan Region
attributes.background:
In order to maintain peace and stability, it is in the vital interest of the west and neighbours to allow the formal process. 

The KRG leadership has declared the need for an imminent referendum; and the region  has proved to be a partner in trade, the fight against terrorism, and peace for all.

attributes.action: Allow HMRC to provide tax exemptions where clerical errors have occurred
attributes.background: I dissolved a company rather than wound it up, and therefore HMRC is applying income tax rather than capital gains tax on the distributions. This was a clerical error, but there is no way to wind back the clock on such errors. HMRC should have the power to apply exemptions under such circumstances.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: reverse the the decision not to allow cashing in of annuities
attributes.background: many people had made financial arrangements based on the promise that annuities could be cashed in

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value £123.00 selling for over £1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Forbid the use of CCTV by local councils for parking enforcement purposes
attributes.background: I am writing this as my local council is using a CCTV camera on a regular basis for the purpose of parking enforcement. The guidelines state this method should be used only "where other means of enforcement are not practical" - but nothing is more practical that a cheap and covert CCTV camera.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from section 1.13 of Surveillance Camera Code of Practice, June 2013, Home office:

"Motorists may regard enforcement by cameras as over-zealous and relevant authorities should use them sparingly. Such systems should , therefore, only be deployed where other means of enforcement are not practical and their effectiveness in achieving this purpose is subject to regular review."

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.

attributes.action: Stop Private Railway Operators from wheel clamping under Railway Byelaw14
attributes.background: Vehicle clamping by private companies was deemed illegal in England and Wales in October 2012. However, Private Railway Operators can still legally exploit an old Railway Byelaw(14) which allows them to continue an aggressive campaign against railway passengers parking in their car parks.
attributes.additional_details:
They enlist private Contractors to handle this duty, and as a result, are generating thousands of pounds in revenue from excessive use of wheel clamping and by applying disproportionate penalties and release costs, for aggressive commercial gain.

Its time this ended, so please sign this petition if you believe the Department of Transport should take action, to ensure Railway Operators and their private clamping Contractors have to abide by the same Laws as anywhere else in the Country.

attributes.action: Make all GP's open for half a day every Saturday or Sunday
attributes.background: There are so many people that can't get time off work for doctor's appointments due to their regular working weeks, example, 9-5 Monday to Friday. Opening the GP's for a couple of hours at the weekend will allow for those that struggle to arrange doctor's appointments without having to book holidays
attributes.additional_details: I work as a healthcare assistant, Monday to Friday, if i didn't turn up to work their would be vulnerable adults left at risk, but I still need to look after my own health, if I get ill so do my clients. Why should I have to book holiday to see the doctor.

attributes.action: parliament make a law. No levy on diesel cars before park & ride system in place
attributes.background:
As an asthmatic i find towns with no Park & Ride, such as Southampton, cause irritation to the lung,s.
It is irresponsible  not to provide the facilities for shopper & visitor traffic to park outside the city.
We cannot clean up air quality, if we just encourage more & more vehicle,s into Towns

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to fill out military medical forms within 48 hours.
attributes.background: Military applicants rely on their doctor to fill out a medical form involving medical history of the applicant. However doctors tend to sit on this paperwork for weeks, delaying the applicants entry process (which is very frustrating).
attributes.additional_details: Doctors get payed by the army, navy, airforce to fill these forms out and still sit on them for weeks even though many forms come with an urgent warning.

attributes.action: Call to ban any form of media that incites xenophobia, racism or hate.
attributes.background: There should be no tolerance to established media holding extreme, sensationalist views that provoke racial segregation, inequality and hatred toward others.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 we should not be using or allowing history to be a light suggestion of how to move forwards in becoming a more balanced and fair society that extends its care not just to the perimeters of its own towns and countries but to the entire world. We live in a multicultural society that extends to a multicultural world and we cannot continue to allow low rate tabloids or any other form of media to provoke anger in to people that gives rise to views of racism and segregation and fuels hatred.

attributes.action: Get Britain to join the North Atlantic Free Trade Area
attributes.background: Britain has left the undemocratic and overbearing EU but we still need to trade with the rest of the world.  So lets join NAFTA and not have to worry about a NAFTA parliament or "ever closer integration".

attributes.action: Give long term partners the same inheritance rights as a spouse
attributes.background: I lost my partner of 25 years, we owned a home and a business together. When he died without leaving a will I had to buy his share of our business, home and buy all of his belongings at the full market value from his only son. I was not financially dependent on him and therefore had no entitlement.

attributes.action: Stop the addictive drug Codeine being sold as an over the counter medicine.
attributes.background:
Many people are finding themselves taking Codeine on a regular basis through over the counter pain killers and cough medicine even when symptoms have stopped.
Codeine is an Opiate drug.
Despite fairly recent warnings on the packets and from sales assistants, people are becoming addicted.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on Codeine addiction and where to get help can be found online.
Many people are using these drugs to relax, get to sleep etc and becoming dependant.
This is a serious problem and health issue with a suprising amount of people finding themselves addicted and sales of these drugs are increasing.
Making these drugs prescription only and providing help for people who have become addicted would be a simple solution to the problem, manufacturers are the only ones benefitting from it.

attributes.action: Keep the BARRED list, scrap the DBS - help people with convictions get jobs.
attributes.background: Prison, fine or anything other than the lifetime of the DBS which prevents many  British people (not so much foreign nationals) from working, as teachers or within the NHS. It is obvious that the British poor tend to be affected.
attributes.additional_details: It will in the long run cause a deficit in British society as more British people are thrown on to the (never get a job heap).

attributes.action: Disallow M.P.s working for firms who have successfully lobbied them as ministers
attributes.background: M.P.s should not profit from their time in office, consorting with firms who lobby them. offering jobs after they leave office, for being compliant with their requests.
attributes.additional_details: Too many M.P.s from the last government and the previous one who held high office went on after losing their seats to take up posts with the very people who had been lobbying them for lucrative  contracts. The health service, television,the eco industry to name a few. M.P.s should be in office to serve the people not feather their nests for the future.

attributes.action: Demand that better aid be provided for countries in need of clean and safe water
attributes.background: This petition is in opposition to the decisions to divert funding from aid made leaders of international development from the UK. Help secure the well being and livelihoods for some the 650 million people (10 times the British population) worldwide who live without something as vital as safe water.
attributes.additional_details:
Many NGOs such as WaterAid fear that the approach to foreign aid made by current British Secretary of State for International Development, Priti Patel, will heavily damage the support that the world's poorest people desperately have to receive. It is imperative that this is corrected the current aid work can have long term, meaningful effect.

https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/sep/14/uk-ngos-raise-concerns-about-priti-patels-new-approach-to-foreign-aid

attributes.action: DBS/CRB should be all cleared with in 5years depending on seriousness e.g theft
attributes.background: It's unfair to those who have changed for the good and find it difficult to get employment. If they havn't committed any other offences during crime that took place should be cleared and give a second chance in life.Also depending on the seriousness of the crime. For petty offences should be cleared

attributes.action: Government must do more to help councils build more council homes
attributes.background: The lack of affordable housing is a chronic problem, and has got worse as years have gone on. I became disabled due to a fall at work, and am now in wheelchair. I suffer with chronic pain. I'm stuck in a first floor flat have been trying for years to get a bungalow or ground floor flat with no luck.

attributes.action: Increase digital government funding and introduce online voting
attributes.background:
- Increase funding of GovUK development
- Introduce citizens' and residents' online certificates for online voting and online conclusion of contracts
attributes.additional_details:
Gov.uk website is a robust but limited online application which is created to simplify life for interacting with government. This petition is aiming to state the importance to increase funding of more rapid development of digital services of the government.
Other ideas to discuss:
- Introduce digital citizenship (see Estonia)
- Introduce emails for all citizens where all communication lands
This may help to make UK more competitive.

attributes.action: Add an extra voting option to the next election of "Electoral Reform!"
attributes.background: Every year I vote for an less popular party as a type of "rebel" vote. This is the only way I feel heard. Now is the time to allow the public to express their concerns about the way OUR government is elected! Brexit has given us a new opportunity to concentrate on The UK! Let us be heard!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/

attributes.action: let Pubs And clubs to sell THC Infused Drinks as a safer alternative to Alcohol
attributes.background:
Amend the misuse of Drugs act  and Psychoactive Substance Bill To allow Pubs And clubs to sell THC Infused Drinks as a safer alternative to Alcohol.
I Believe this will reduce the level of drink related crime and is well known to be much less physically harmful than alcohol

attributes.action: Introduce a plan of anti-ransomware measures
attributes.background: Ransomware computer viruses target more and more ordinary UK citizens and organizations. Viruses like described here: http://myspybot.com/odin-virus/ cause huge damages. Millions flow away into cyber criminals' pockets. We want to know what is being done to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
Plenty of things an be done:

 - Government can strengthen cryptocurrencies related laws. For example, make Bitcoin exchange companies keep records of their users.   

- Government can cooperate with security professionals to develop decryption tools.

- Government can introduce stronger online data protection policies. Organizations should create backups of their data.

- Government can raise awareness that we should stop paying to hackers. Make paying immoral and maybe illegal.

attributes.action: Stop tax exiles from claiming government subsidies of any sort
attributes.background:
If anyone chooses to be a tax exile and not pay their fair share of tax to the British people then they should be excluded from the tax system completely, this  should include receiving any form of taxpayers money
If they wish to opt out of the system they should opt out completely

attributes.action: We want a government run school bus system similar to America's.
attributes.background: As a student I understand the ridiculous bus prices which we have to pay to even go to school. I believe that as we have a right to education it is wrong that parents have to pay up to £12 a day For us to go school. As well as this students who ride on private coaches have to pay up to £300 a year.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a student who has three siblings going to the same school. His mother has to pay £8.85 each day just for her children to go to school. 

I believe that the American system of having government run school buses is greatly superior to our system now.

I understand like most things in this world this will cost money, my suggestion is to raise council tax by £1-3 and use that money to set up a government run bus system. There are 27 million households in the UK, meaning £81 million a month.

attributes.action: 80 characters is not enough to express a political request. Extend limit to >999
attributes.background: I want to write a petition to the government not a twitter comment and I want people to understand from the outset what I want and why. Limiting the number of charterers I can write is extremely restrictive to allowing voters to express themselves.

attributes.action: Give employees rights post-probation so they can't be unfairly sacked
attributes.background: I was recently dismissed without my boss following disciplinary procedures. Employees only get job protection after two years, making it easy for SMEs to dismiss staff for unfair reasons. The law needs updating to protect the millions of people employed post probation until they reach two years.
attributes.additional_details:
On the Gov.UK website it states - Before taking any action, your employer should: follow disciplinary procedures or give you a chance to improve 

Small businesses accounted for 99.3% of all private sector businesses at the start of 2015 with 15.6 million people employed by SMEs. After seeking legal advice on the subject ACAS disciplinary procedures only apply after two years. So small businesses do not need to apply these and can unceremoniously make it easy to dismiss staff.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the press to use entrapment to produce 'sensational' stories
attributes.background:
It is too easy for journalists to entrap an unsuspecting victim into revealing information that they wouldn't volunteer if they knew that they were talking to the press.
This can cause people to lose their jobs or cause humiliation
It is deceitful and fraudulent. But is it in the public interest.
attributes.additional_details:
Sex Scandals, Politicians, Celebrities. The only reason they do it is to increase their market share, yet claim it is in the public interest.
This could ruin an aspiring politician, business person or celebrity for a good scoop.
Most recent case is Sam Alerdice, the former England Manager, who revealed some embarrassing 'trade secrets' to what he thought were businessmen, but were gutter press.

attributes.action: Restrict the ability to freely purchase sperm on Internet websites and now apps
attributes.background: It is grossly unacceptable to completely disregard a mans ability and purpose to father children. Women have the ability to freely browse Internet websites and now mobile apps for sprem based on specific requirements of donors eg height, IQ, race "without a medical reason". It's morally wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
I don't want to promote the websites and/or apps but it's free to download and sperm can be bought for the price of £950 at the click of a button without a medical reason.
If this catches on it could be a huge problem that would leave men unable to naturally father children and I find this seriously disturbing.

attributes.action: Request the Football Association to boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background: Russia's state-sponsored drugs abuse in sport, human rights contraventions, cyber hacking, actions in Ukraine and Syria, and total disdain for world opinion, demonstrates that it should not be rewarded by being allowed to host a World event.

attributes.action: Reduce NI Contributions for those on PAYE to the level of the self employed
attributes.background: If the self employed are entitled to the same benefits as those paying NI through PAYE the rates should have parity. Government cannot raise NI for the self employed, lowering the rate for those who pay via PAYE is an option.
attributes.additional_details: The chancellor has been forced to drop an increase in NI contributions for the self employed due to manifesto pledges. The manifesto did not preclude lowering the rate for others.

attributes.action: Scrap the Barnett formula - all regions of the UK should get equal funding
attributes.background: All the people of these isles are equal so they should get an equal amount spent on them.  The Barnett formula has created inequalities where Scotland gets much more than other parts of the UK.    This has led to cuts in services in other parts of the UK and needs to be resolved as soon as possible

attributes.action: Make benefit claimants do 10 hours free work a week to help community projects.
attributes.background: As the government keeps on cutting money for councils, they have an ever growing problem of finding additional funds to do community projects. Therefore some tasks are no longer undertook by the council like they once were. This can be seen from local parks to general litter picking.
attributes.additional_details: Solving this would be to enforce that people who recieve benefits would be required to undertake 10hrs free work a week to recieve their benefits. It would help the community and also give experience to the people whom recieve them. The people whom claim benefits would have to be accessed to see if they are capable and fit to undetake the tasks of the community.

attributes.action: Stop foreign aid to other countries until after Brexit
attributes.background: We need to stop foreign aid until we have left the EU and have our spending and taxes balanced. Help British before giving our hard earned money away!

attributes.action: Make football available across all viewing platforms at reasonable cost
attributes.background: In 2007 the European Union demanded that Premier League football TV rights be split to end the monopoly that BSkyB had over televised football in the UK. They said the new system would provide football fans with "greater choice and better value". In reality the opposite has happened.
attributes.additional_details: Football fans are now having to pay for two subscriptions in order to watch all the available matches. This hardly provides better value and is leading to the increase in illegal online streaming of matches. We would ask the government to look at this ruling, especially with the impending UK exit from the European Union, and ask that all rights holders make their HD channels available to each other on a wholesale basis to end the current system of needing two expensive subscriptions.

attributes.action: Make law and politics a core study in high school; like maths, English & science
attributes.background:
As the popular proverb suggests "knowledge is power."Thus, it seems to me our electorate is powerless! 

We complain about the turnout for elections and that people don't really understand the political and legal systems (especially 18 to 24s). So let's do something about it
attributes.additional_details:
Quite often in elections less than 50% of young people between the ages of 18 & 24 actually vote. Furthermore, it is often less than 70% of eligible voters who actually vote. 

In the general election 2015, 43% of 18 to 24s voted and only 66% of all eligible voters cast a vote. This is not good enough. 

https://www.ipsos-mori.com/researchpublications/researcharchive/3575/How-Britain-voted-in-2015.aspx

attributes.action: Replace the unelected House of Lords with a system comparable with jury service
attributes.background: Replacing the unelected House of Lords with a system comparable with a 'jury service' will enable Bills to be scrutinized apolitically thus ensuring laws can be passed or rejected on face value. No direct political loyalty should be allowed in an attempt to depoliticise the 'upper house'.

attributes.action: Curb betting adverting around football matches and ban impulse bets.
attributes.background:
A ban should be placed on betting advertising within 30 minutes of the start of football matches; and a ban should be placed on in play and 'impulse' bets and their aggressive advertising.
Firms should be forced to allow 1 minute cooling off period on all bets to stop people betting impulsively
attributes.additional_details:
Since legalisation of advertising for betting in the U.K. we have seen an increase in problematic gambling, coinciding with the rise of betting on apps and the subsequent increase in advertising spend. New demographics are targeted, the industry now intertwined with football and is impossible to ignore.
Companies are now failing in their duty of care to their customers by providing quicker and quicker ways to bet, alongside aggressively advertising odds to encourage impulsive betting patterns.

attributes.action: GCSE students receive a letter grade instead of a number grade for all subjects
attributes.background: For many years, GCSE students have received a letter grade instead of a number grade, so hanging it is inconvenient and confusing. It would be hard to tell what grade is good and Universities will find this a challenge.
attributes.additional_details: This change would be made for all subjects, including the core subjects, to simplify the grading system and stop and confusion.

attributes.action: Reduce UK overseas aid, release monies to NHS and local authorities
attributes.background: With immigration at an all time high, plus an ever aging population, it should not come as a surprise that local authorities and the NHS are struggling to cope. Monies currently earmarked for overseas aid should be spent at home, where charity is supposed to begin.

attributes.action: Make fast, MANDATORY  PIP awards to cancer patients already on lower PIP
attributes.background: Cancer patients already awarded PIP for existing illnesses have to chance losing what they have already been awarded by having to make a completely new claim when diagnosed with Cancer. Enough stress comes with Cancer without having to worry about finances and the potential loss of income.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-rescue cats and dogs In pet stores.
attributes.background:
San Francisco enacted a new law stating that pet shops can only sell cats and dogs that come from rescue centres.

Let's follow in their footsteps to ensure that rescued animals find a home before dogs and cats are needlessly bred for profit!
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, the RSPCA alone rescued and collected 118,994 animals. In the same year, 5,142 had to be put down because of overcrowding in shelters and lack of resources. 

We, the people of the UK, request a law that will ensure that pet stores will help find homes for the hundreds of thousands of dogs and cats left to be forgotten BEFORE breeding more!

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/39004663

http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/609353/The-Dogs-Trust-stray-dog-crisis-in-UK

attributes.action: Students to have over an hour and a half of Physical Education a week
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that students have to have over an hour and a half of physical education per week.

attributes.action: Conduct a full review into Business Rates to make them fairer to small business.
attributes.background: The upcoming revaluation of business rates will result in crippling increases to some small businesses already struggling to compete with online retailers. We call upon the government to postpone the revaluation until a full review has been carried out and the sytem made fairer to small business.

attributes.action: Create Protocol for Government Intervention in Strikes (e.g. Southern stalemate)
attributes.background: We would like to petition the government to seriously contemplate introducing a system in which labour disputes involving services essential to our economy, such as the Southern rail strike, can be handled in the case of long-running disruption and lack of agreement between the principle parties.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the that government consider methods implemented by other nations, for example Canada, where the options include binding arbitration [For more information: http://www.cbc.ca/1.1000525]

Though we cannot quantify what the Southern rail strike has cost the economy, it certainly has had an effect; ramifications on citizens' lives must also be appreciated. In situations such as these, it would be beneficial to have a governmental framework in place. 

With thanks for your consideration.
